humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report states that eight lymph nodes are positive for tumor in the right axilla. This corresponds to N2 according to the AJCC staging system. Specifically, N2a indicates metastases in 4 to 9 axillary lymph nodes. However, the report only mentions eight positive lymph nodes, so the patient's N stage would be N2a. The report also mentions extensive extracapsular extension and deposits larger than 2 mm, which are factors that would typically upstage the N stage, but the AJCC staging system does not provide separate substaging categories for these factors in the N2a category.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The patient's pathology report indicates that there are eight lymph nodes positive for tumor in the right axilla, with extensive extracapsular extension and deposits larger than 2 mm. This information supports the classification of N2 (metastasis in 4 to 9 axillary lymph nodes).
